definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it

sentences.english: Lincoln, in contrast, is sui generis.
sentences.chinese: 相反，林肯则是独一无二的。

sentences.english: Thus, Palau Jellyfish Lake has the world's only non-toxic jellyfish.
sentences.chinese: 这样，帕劳水母湖拥有了世界上独一无二的无毒水母。

sentences.english: Worshiping the true God is only way to be blessed.
sentences.chinese: 只有尊崇独一的真神才会蒙福。
这是禧玛诺独一无二的设计。

sentences.english: The Arabesque solution is the answer toadesigner's desire for uniqueness.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉伯风为设计师渴望独一无二给出了答案。

sentences.english: My person is a unique one. Please don't compare me with my brother or sister.
sentences.chinese: 我的人格是独一无二的，请勿拿我与兄姊比较。

sentences.english: Instead, I was made to be unique.
sentences.chinese: 反而，我被创造成独一无二的。

sentences.english: The architecture in ancient Greek is really the unique sculptures.
sentences.chinese: 古希腊的建筑的确是独一无二的雕塑品。

sentences.english: The culture of bankruptcy is unique.
sentences.chinese: 破产文化是独一无二的。
基督是我们至高独一的裁判。

sentences.english: I was the only umbrella, still wet of the people?
sentences.chinese: 我是独一有伞，依然淋湿的人吗？

sentences.english: But T. rex's tail was unique.
sentences.chinese: 霸王龙的尾部是独一无二的。

sentences.english: We all have the same memories, is the only little some past.
sentences.chinese: 我们都有一样的回忆，独一就是少了些过去。

sentences.english: You are unique and can do a limited number of things well.
sentences.chinese: 你是独一的，你只能把有限的事情做好。

sentences.english: There really is nothing like the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 说真的，世界杯确实是独一无二。

sentences.english: Every woman has her own unique brand of charisma.
sentences.chinese: 每个女人都有她独一无二的魅力商标。

definition: one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
fully deserving, without any reservations (idiom); entirely worthy (of a title, honor etc)
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
